dismissalText.commentary: Aiden Markram c â Taylor b Tiripano 35 (49b 6x4 0x6 63m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: got him! Tiripano has done it. Markram doesn't last long after surviving the run-out chance. It's a short and wide ball outside off and he's looked to whack the leather off it. But it looks like that has extra climb on it and he's not able to adjust for that. Big edge to Taylor's right

headshotImage.caption: Dean Elgar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dean Elgar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: outside edge carries through to Taylor and Elgar's habit of pushing inside the line has cost him his wicket. Looks like he was defending on the front foot for the one that comes back in, but this holds the line and slants across. He's not played this close to the body and it just carries to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: finds midwicket! Klaasen picks the wrong ball to play a release shot. It's not there for the pull - just a tad too full. It's a strangely angled bat as a result. The ball has slanted in as well as he looks to go off the front foot. It's off the inside half and Mire lunges to his right and holds on

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: given caught behind and Phehlukwayo is not happy about this. It's a length ball down leg side. He's looked to flick and there's a sound as this goes past the stumps and to Taylor. Looks like the batsman is annoyed with himself, because replays show no evidence of pad on that and there's a woody sound. He's done so well and it must sting to be caught down leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Hendricks b Phehlukwayo 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: straight to second slip! This is falling apart quickly for Zimbabwe. Chigumbura is their last specialist batsman. He's looked to get a single at third man but his late cut is a lazy waft in the end and he has guided a simple catch for Hendricks. It was a short of a length ball with not enough room outside off for the cut

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara c Steyn b Imran Tahir 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 27.27

commentTextItems.html: picks the one fielder out on the leg side! It's a slider dropped short on middle stump. He gets good bat on this but he manages to hit this short-arm pull straight to deep midwicket. That is six for Tahir and a 120-run win for South Africa.

commentPostTextItems.html: 7:53pm And that is all from us. Thanks for joining.

Duminy: Pitch certainly wasn't ideal. It's not the pitch we've come to know here. But from the position we were in to get 198 was good, seeing Dale apply himself the way he did. If you look at the surfaces we've had, it's been tough for the batsmen to grab the opportunities. But again, it's a chance to play for the national team and there's one more chance. It's really good signs for us, the way the bowlers are doing heading into this summer. We're hoping that the wicket in Paarl where quite a few runs will be scored and good opportunities will be presented and hopefully the guys will take them.

Steyn: Any time it's quite difficult and the wicket was quite tough. But the opening bowlers bowled out and myself and Andi batted it out in five-over spells. The thing is I've been playing cricket, which is nice. In the past I've come into series' from the winter, but I've been playing recently and I feel cricket fit. There was a nice breeze behind me, there was pace in the wicket. The wicket was a little up and down and there is always help. Tough for the batters. I thought Zimbabwe bowled really well.
Dale Steyn is the Man of the Match.

Masakadza: We controlled such a large part of the first half that it's disappointing how it went in the end. The guys bowled really well up front, but we just couldn't close it off. Definitely need more application with the bat. We lost a couple when it was going up and down and then it eased out. Disappointing that we lost so many wickets to spin on a pitch like this. We always felt we were in the game, chasing 200, plenty of experience. We just needed a couple of partnerships.

7:35pm That is also the series for South Africa. Wow, what a day it has been. Zimbabwe had their best chance to get one over South Africa today. They had them on the mat at 101 for 7, allowed a comeback, and even after all that, needed a very gettable score. As it turned out, even if South Africa had stopped their innings at 7-down, they would have won extremely comfortably. Dale Steyn owned most of this match - a 60 and then two early wickets. Ngidi got a few to bounce up nastily off the pitch and immediately Zimbabwe's batsmen looked anxious. That was where the crack was made, and Tahir turned it into a full blown gash. Ripped through the lower-middle order. Properly. A hat-trick and a six-wicket haul. What could have been an exciting chase has finished in 24 overs.

headshotImage.longCaption: Khaya Zondo, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Khaya Zondo st â Taylor b Mavuta 21 (28b 2x4 1x6 58m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: the bowler has the last laugh he may have been hit for four, but he kept giving it air, and got Zondo stretching forward. It was outside off again, and drew the batsman enough forward to drag his foot outside the crease, with the 'keeper quick to whip off the bails

dismissalText.commentary: Christiaan Jonker b Mavuta 25 (19b 4x4 1x6 23m) SR: 131.57

dismissalComment.html: through him Jonker was living by the sword, he dies by it. Tossed up and drifting in to pitch on leg stump, straightens enough to beat an almighty swing and break the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Jarvis 5 (20b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: big shout and given slanted across, but pitched in line and came back in a touch. Just enough to beat the bat, and not enough to be missing the stumps. That looked out in real-time. The move to bring back Jarvis has worked immediately

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andile Phehlukwayo c â Taylor b Chatara 28 (44b 1x4 1x6 80m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: given caught behind and Phehlukwayo is not happy about this. It's a length ball down leg side. He's looked to flick and there's a sound as this goes past the stumps and to Taylor. Looks like the batsman is annoyed with himself, because replays show no evidence of pad on that and there's a woody sound. He's done so well and it must sting to be caught down leg side

headshotImage.caption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn b Tiripano 60 (85b 8x4 1x6 92m) SR: 70.58

dismissalComment.html: misses a full toss and loses middle stump. South Africa fall short of 200. He's looked to heave this but completely misses

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir lbw b Williams 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front and he's gone. Another full, slow ball on middle stump. Tahir looking to dead-bat this has gone through it too early - his bat is blocked by his boot as a result. Much before the ball has arrived and hit him in front of middle

dismissalComment.html: got 'im he's caught on the crease, It comes in with the angle, perhaps off the seam too, and beats him. The variable bounce has probably contributed to him not coming forward or going back decisively

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Phehlukwayo b Steyn 3 (24b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 12.5

dismissalComment.html: Phehlukwayo plucks it out of the air Steyn has two wickets now to go with his 60. Dug this in short, and he tried to pull it, but the fielder at short midwicket flies to his right to hold on with both hands. That came off the toe-end of the bat

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor lbw b Imran Tahir 10 (17b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: the googly gets him he didn't read it, and it beats his forward defensive shot and cannons into the pad. Tahir appeals and almost takes off on his run while still appealing

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: st â Klaasen b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams st â Klaasen b Imran Tahir 9 (8b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: appeal for stumping as Tahir rips a googly past Williams' outside edge. Klaasen looks confident. And it appears the base of WIlliams' foot has lifted and the toe isn't behind the line...that's out. Quick work from Klaasen after Tahir completely flummoxes the batsman after drawing him forward.

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Imran Tahir 5 (20b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: that's plumb. Moor doesn't put in any sort of a stride against this full ball. It's a slider on leg stump. He's playing an off stump line. It's very soft and very meek - it's an embodiment of this chase. Tahir is on a hat-trick.

headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Reeza Hendricks player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Reeza Hendricks player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Hendricks b Phehlukwayo 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: straight to second slip! This is falling apart quickly for Zimbabwe. Chigumbura is their last specialist batsman. He's looked to get a single at third man but his late cut is a lazy waft in the end and he has guided a simple catch for Hendricks. It was a short of a length ball with not enough room outside off for the cut

headshotImage.caption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Donald Tiripano player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Donald Tiripano not out 12 (16b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 75
Brandon Mavuta b Imran Tahir 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: hat-trick! Tahir has burst through Mavuta's defence with a googly and tonked his off stump. Fourth South African to do it after Langeveldt, Duminy and Rabada. It was on a length, it drew the batsman forward, and it was too good for him.

headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Jarvis b Imran Tahir 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Jarvis with a heave across the line and he's lost leg stump. Among other things. It's another googly, at a length. Lobbed up slow, front leg out of the way. Misses. Just as well - the fast bowlers were waiting to have a go at Jarvis next over, no doubt. Tahir gets his third five-wicket haul in ODIs.

dismissalText.commentary: Tendai Chatara c Steyn b Imran Tahir 3 (11b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 27.27

dismissalComment.html: picks the one fielder out on the leg side! It's a slider dropped short on middle stump. He gets good bat on this but he manages to hit this short-arm pull straight to deep midwicket. That is six for Tahir and a 120-run win for South Africa.
